p: Pathogenic hantaviruses are the etiologic agents of two clinical syndromes in humans, namely hemorrhagic fever with renal syndrome (HFRS) in Eurasia and hantavirus (cardio)pulmonary syndrome in the Americas [ 1]. The viruses are primarily carried by rodents, shrews, moles, and bats [ 2]. Transmission to humans occurs via aerosols or dust particles of virus-contaminated rodent urine, feces, or saliva, and probably also via food or hands contaminated by these excretions [ 3].
